Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase II: Single Crystal Group III-Nitride Bulk Acoustic Resonators and Bulk Acoustic Wave Filter Components for Mobile Communications
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project will be to enable the development and commercialization of single crystal piezoelectric Bulk Acoustic Wave (BAW) filters targeting the mobile wireless market, providing much needed improvements over the incumbent poly-crystalline technology in critical components used in all smartphones and other wireless devices. The technical advantage based upon this innovation in single crystal piezoelectric material provides improvements in key parameters that will benefit consumers of the smartphone, of particular note are component insertion losses which will result in increased battery life and reducing the complexity of the RF front-end. Additionally, the commercialization of this technology will address cellular component market demand not being serviced with the incumbent technology. There is a general lack of competition around the incumbent technology based on limited access to existing intellectual property. The technology developed under this SBIR will enable new participants in this growing market.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project will enable the first comprehensive study of wide bandgap, group III-Nitride single crystal materials for bulk mode resonator technology. This technology is the fundamental building block of RF filter technology and addresses a critical need in today's RF frontends. The need arises from the filter's location (between amplifier and antenna) and performance (half the power is lost due to inefficiencies). As a result, components must be over-designed to accommodate for the filter loss. The excessive losses degrade battery life and drive higher thermal management costs in the system. To address this need, a more efficient, lower loss Bulk Acoustic Wave (BAW) filter with lower losses and dramatically improved performance is proposed and offers high payoff in the end market. The effort continues the design and simulation of single-crystal piezoelectric resonators to support resonant frequencies from 1 to 6 GHz. Piezoelectric materials are synthesized on 150-mm silicon substrates and fabricated into resonators and BAW filters using an experimental fabrication process flow and novel circuit designs.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The focus of Akoustis Technologies’ Phase II SBIR effort was to build upon the success of our Phase I program and execute on the advanced research and development activities required to commercialize our disruptive single crystal piezoelectric based Bulk Acoustic Wave (BAW) radio frequency (RF) resonator and filter technology. In order to achieve this ambitious objective we focused on the following areas for our program goals: (1) The development and optimization of robust simulation models to aid in the design and optimization of this technology, (2) the development of the single crystal piezoelectric materials capable of meeting the demanding performance requirements, (3) a robust, scalable, and manufacturable wafer fabrication process capable of forming the raw materials into specification compliant BAW RF Filters, (4) a suitable packing technology which allows for our business development team to provide specification compliant customer samples so that we can (5) Engage top tier OEM and ODM suppliers and clearly demonstrate the performance advantages that our single crystal materials based technology offers.

During our Phase II SBIR program Akoustis conceived, developed, reduced to practice, and successfully qualified our patented single crystal bulk acoustic wave (BAW) technology for high-band RF filters for mobile and other wireless applications. This technology, called “XBAW”, encompasses both the first-generation wafer fabrication process and the underlying single crystal materials processes. The XBAW-1 (XB1) process establishes the industry’s first single crystal BAW technology for the expanding RF filter market for 4G/LTE, 5G mobile, 5G infrastructure, WiFi, military radar and other applications. The XB1 process features:

  • Patented single crystal piezoelectric materials
  • Novel MEMS wafer manufacturing
  • High-Frequency RF performance from 1.5 GHz - 7 GHz
  • High power handling and wide bandwidth performance
  • Compatibility with conventional and flip-chip packaging

Reaching this critical milestone, we have transitioned from pure R&D to the commercialization of our patented single crystal BAW technology. We are now positioned to concentrate on the delivery of high-performance RF filters for current customer engagements to support WiFi, mobile devices and infrastructure, radar and other wireless applications. We expect to achieve full product qualification of our first three announced products later this calendar year now that our patented technology has been fully qualified in our New York wafer manufacturing facility.
